Released: 16 June 2025

This is a minor release that includes bug fixes and small enhancements.

## Highlights

- Add support for the `retrieve_text()` function when using volumes as data sources for knowledge base pipelines.
- Bug fix for local file processing in volume knowledge bases.
- Bug fix for easy model syncing in hybrid manager deployments.
- Add support for preparer pipeline volume destination in foreign schemas.

## Enhancements

<table class="table w-100"><thead><tr><th>Description</th><th width="10%">Addresses</th></tr></thead><tbody>
<tr><td><details><summary>Add support for the <code>retrieve_text()</code> function when using volumes as data sources for knowledge base pipelines.</summary><hr/><p>The <code>retrieve_text()</code> function can now be used with knowledge bases that use volumes as data source. Previously, only <code>retrieve_key()</code> was supported and users had to manually load the content of the objects in they application.</p>
</details></td><td></td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Fewer mandatory values when configuring preparer pipelines.</summary><hr/><p>Added default values for some preparer pipeline options to reduce the number of mandatory settings.</p>
</details></td><td></td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Add support for preparer pipeline volume destination in foreign schemas.</summary><hr/><p>Volumes used as destinations for preparer pipelines can now be located in arbitrary schemas within the postgres database. This completes &quot;schema support&quot; for AIDB.</p>
</details></td><td></td></tr>
</tbody></table>


## Bug Fixes

<table class="table w-100"><thead><tr><th>Description</th><th width="10%">Addresses</th></tr></thead><tbody>
<tr><td><details><summary>Bug fix for local file processing in volume knowledge bases.</summary><hr/><p>An issue existed where a number of local files in a volume knowledge base were not processed due to an issue with the ordering of file results. This has been fixed.</p>
</details></td><td></td></tr>
<tr><td><details><summary>Bug fix for easy model syncing in hybrid manager deployments.</summary><hr/><p>The <code>sync_hcp_models()</code> function used to automatically create AIDB models in hybrid manager deployments resulted in non-working model configurations. This is now fixed.</p>
</details></td><td></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
